assumptions.v1Assumption: The buyer titles are likely to be attorneys or paralegals, as the product is designed to assist in legal case preparation and evidence review.
assumptions.evidenceFromDeck: The buyer titles are likely to be attorneys or paralegals, as the product is designed to assist in legal case preparation and evidence review.
assumptions.confidenceExplanation: Validated through 3 interviews with confirmed attorney titles

quotes.text: As a criminal defense attorney, I spend way too much time sifting through evidence files.
quotes.speaker: Sarah Mitchell

quotes.text: Our paralegal team handles most of the initial evidence review, but we attorneys need to validate everything.
quotes.speaker: Michael Chen

assumptions.v1Assumption: The company size can vary from small to large law firms, as the product is used by thousands of lawyers from different sized firms.
assumptions.evidenceFromDeck: The company size can vary from small to large law firms, as the product is used by thousands of lawyers from different sized firms.
assumptions.confidenceExplanation: Interviews show strong interest from mid-size firms (10-50 attorneys) but limited validation from large firms

quotes.text: Our firm has about 25 attorneys and we all struggle with the same evidence management issues.
quotes.speaker: Sarah Mitchell

assumptions.v1Assumption: The main pain points are the time and effort spent on manual review of evidence, the disorganization of multimedia files, and the disadvantage defense teams face due to the prosecution's head start.
assumptions.evidenceFromDeck: The main pain points are the time and effort spent on manual review of evidence, the disorganization of multimedia files, and the disadvantage defense teams face due to the prosecution's head start.
assumptions.confidenceExplanation: All interviewed attorneys confirmed these exact pain points with specific examples

quotes.text: I spend 60% of my time just organizing and reviewing evidence files. It's incredibly inefficient.
quotes.speaker: Sarah Mitchell

quotes.text: The prosecution always gets their evidence organized first. We're constantly playing catch-up.
quotes.speaker: David Rodriguez

quotes.text: Video and audio files are the worst - they're scattered across different systems and impossible to search through quickly.
quotes.speaker: Jennifer Wong
